alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morgan and northwestern Johnson Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Greenwood, or 15 miles south of Indianapolis. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Morgan and northwestern Johnson Counties, including the following locations... New Whiteland, Whiteland, Waverly and Bargersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
